1.text: Be ye therefore imitators of God, as beloved children,

2.text: and walk in love, even as the Christ loved us, and delivered himself up for us, an offering and sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling savour.

3.text: But fornication and all uncleanness or unbridled lust, let it not be even named among you, as it becomes saints;

4.text: and filthiness and foolish talking, or jesting, which are not convenient; but rather thanksgiving.

5.text: For this ye are [well] informed of, knowing that no fornicator, or unclean person, or person of unbridled lust, who is an idolater, has inheritance in the kingdom of the Christ and God.

6.text: Let no one deceive you with vain words, for on account of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience.

7.text: Be not ye therefore fellow-partakers with them;

8.text: for ye were once darkness, but now light in [the] Lord; walk as children of light,

9.text: (for the fruit of the light [is] in all goodness and righteousness and truth,)

10.text: proving what is agreeable to the Lord;

11.text: and do not have fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather also reprove [them],

12.text: for the things that are done by them in secret it is shameful even to say.

13.text: But all things having their true character exposed by the light are made manifest; for that which makes everything manifest is light.

14.text: Wherefore he says, Wake up, [thou] that sleepest, and arise up from among the dead, and the Christ shall shine upon thee.

15.text: See therefore how ye walk carefully, not as unwise but as wise,

16.text: redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

17.text: For this reason be not foolish, but understanding what [is] the will of the Lord.

18.text: And be not drunk with wine, in which is debauchery; but be filled with the Spirit,

19.text: speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and chanting with your heart to the Lord;

20.text: giving thanks at all times for all things to him [who is] God and [the] Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ,

21.text: submitting yourselves to one another in [the] fear of Christ.

22.text: Wives, [submit yourselves] to your own husbands, as to the Lord,

23.text: for a husband is head of the wife, as also the Christ [is] head of the assembly. He [is] Saviour of the body.

24.text: But even as the assembly is subjected to the Christ, so also wives to their own husbands in everything.

25.text: Husbands, love your own wives, even as the Christ also loved the assembly, and has delivered himself up for it,

26.text: in order that he might sanctify it, purifying [it] by the washing of water by [the] word,

27.text: that he might present the assembly to himself glorious, having no spot, or wrinkle, or any of such things; but that it might be holy and blameless.

28.text: So ought men also to love their own wives as their own bodies: he that loves his own wife loves himself.

29.text: For no one has ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, even as also the Christ the assembly:

30.text: for we are members of his body; [we are of his flesh, and of his bones.]

31.text: Because of this a man shall leave his father and mother, and shall be united to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh.

32.text: This mystery is great, but I speak as to Christ, and as to the assembly.

33.text: But ye also, every one of you, let each so love his own wife as himself; but as to the wife [I speak] that she may fear the husband.
